title: Looking for code of conduct committee members
body:
As the sktime community is growing, we are actively seeking for volunteer members of the community to act as members of our code of conduct committee.
The code of conduct committee acts as a first point of contact in a case of code of conduct related matters, including suspected violations.
Membership comes with the voluntary commitment to participate in, and contribute to, proceedings of the committee.
Such proceedings typically include updates to the code of conduct, and deliberation and adjudication in potential violation cases.
Depending on affiliation (academic or not), acting as a code of conduct committee member may require signing of a non-disclosure agreement.
The code of conduct committee meets irregularly, typically twice a year, and more frequently if necessary.

We especially welcome and encourage expression of interests from community members who are not core contributors or help bringing more diverse viewpoints to the committee.
Previous experience of relevant committee proceedings or panel memberships (ethics, diversity, HR, â€¦) is desired and helpful, but not strictly necessary.

For any inquiries or expressions of interest, please send an e-mail to f.kiraly[at]ucl.ac.uk, markus.loning.17[at]ucl.ac.uk, and anthony.bagnall[at]uea.ac.uk.
Expressions of interest should be accompanied by a CV, a paragraph on motivation, and a description of prior relevant experience.
Community members expressing interest will then be invited to an interview.
Interviews and expressions of interest are non-competing.

Questions about the role can be asked in this issue.
This issue and the opportunity will remain open at least until March 2021.
